nodes.bodyText: What is the purpose of reading through the file here? I don't see "is" used anywhere else.

Its because the input stream is wrapped in a DigestInputStream
https://github.com/UNC-Libraries/Carolina-Digital-Repository/pull/1022/files#diff-7e1c346f26b46834efa5d9ed91646b62R83-R90
When you read the contents of the stream, it calculates one or more digests. You could consume the contents of the stream for some other purpose, like writing the stream to a file or something, and it would still calculate the digests. That is why this block is wrapped in if (!streamRetrieved), so that it won't try to re-read the stream. But if we had not already read the stream at the time that digests are needed, then we have to read it. This is the case for the FixityCheckJob since it is loading the files just for the sake of checksumming.
